skill.name: mail-workflow
skill.desc: Async message queue for items needing attention.
skill.structure:
``` META/mail/ inbox/ # unprocessed read/ # processed, kept for reference trash/ # discarded, ~30 day retention ```
File format: `YYYYMMDD-HHMM-slug.md`
skill.format:
```markdown # Title
Brief description.
## Context - Source, relevance, related files
## Questions - Clarifying questions, options to consider ```
One topic per item. Split if too big.
skill.sources: - Human scratch files (backlog, notes, etc.) — process into mail items - Cross-project — bugs in vendored libs go to that project's mail - Agent discoveries — bugs, missing features, tech debt
skill.processing:
1. Read and understand 2. Decide: ticket, quick-fix, defer, or discard 3. Take action 4. **Move** (not copy) to `read/` or `trash/` with disposition
**CRITICAL**: Use `mv`, never `cp`. Item must exist in exactly ONE directory. ```bash mv META/mail/inbox/{item}.md META/mail/read/ ls META/mail/inbox/{item}.md # should fail: No such file ```
When moving to `read/`, append: ```markdown ---
## Marked as Read
**Disposition**: ticket | quick-fix | defer | discard **Date**: YYYY-MM-DD **Notes**: What was decided **Ticket**: META/tickets/todo/slug.md (if applicable) ```
skill.outcomes: - **Ticket** → `META/tickets/todo/`, item to `read/` - **Quick fix** → implement directly, item to `read/` - **Decompose** → split into multiple inbox items - **Defer** → note reason, move to `read/` - **Discard** → move to `trash/`
skill.cleanup: Trash items deleted after ~30 days: `find META/mail/trash -mtime +30 -delete`
